data.value: https://nicksnettravels.builttoroam.com/post/2017/01/24/Admin-Consent-for-Permissions-in-Azure-Active-Directory.aspx https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/manage-apps/configure-user-consent#configure-user-consent-to-applications https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/benchmarks/security-controls-v2-privileged-access#pa-1-protect-and-limit-highly-privileged-users https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/benchmarks/security-controls-v2-privileged-access#pa-2-restrict-administrative-access-to-business-critical-systems https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/benchmarks/security-controls-v2-governance-strategy#gs-2-define-enterprise-segmentation-strategy https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/benchmarks/security-controls-v2-governance-strategy#gs-6-define-identity-and-privileged-access-strategy

data.name: UserConsentCompanyData_Rationale
data.value: Users can consent to apps accessing company data on their behalf

data.name: UserConsentCompanyData_Solution
data.value:
The recommendation is to require admin consent to grant consent to external applications.
Open the Azure Console Go to Azure Active Directory Go to Users Go to User settings Click on Manage how end users launch and view their applications Under the Enterprise applications heading. Set Users can consent to apps accessing company data on their behalf to No

data.name: UserConsentCompanyData_TechnicalExplanation
data.value: By default any users can grant some permissions to applications. A malicious application,typically sent to the user as a phishing link, can be granted rights such as reading all AzureAD data by any users.

data.name: UserConsentCompanyData_Title
data.value: Check if users can consent to any app

data.value: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/fundamentals/users-default-permissions#member-and-guest-users https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/benchmarks/security-controls-v2-privileged-access#pa-5-automate-entitlement-management https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/benchmarks/security-controls-v2-governance-strategy#gs-2-define-enterprise-segmentation-strategy https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/benchmarks/security-controls-v2-governance-strategy#gs-6-define-identity-and-privileged-access-strategy

data.name: GuestUserAccessRestriction1_Rationale
data.value: Guest users have the same access level as a normal user

data.name: GuestUserAccessRestriction1_Solution
data.value: Open the Azure Console Go to Azure Active Directory Go to External Identities Go to External collaboration settings Under "Guest user access", change the value to "Guest users have limited access to properties and memberships of directory objects" (default value)

data.name: GuestUserAccessRestriction1_TechnicalExplanation
data.value: By default guests users are restricted from exploring the directory. The current policy value allows guests to list all objects in the directory and their properties as a normal user

data.name: GuestUserAccessRestriction1_Title
data.value: Check if guests have the same access level than normal users

data.name: GuestUserAccessRestriction2_Detail
data.value: GuestUserRoleId: {0}

data.name: GuestUserAccessRestriction2_Documentation
data.value: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/fundamentals/users-default-permissions#member-and-guest-users https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/benchmarks/security-controls-v2-privileged-access#pa-5-automate-entitlement-management https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/benchmarks/security-controls-v2-governance-strategy#gs-2-define-enterprise-segmentation-strategy https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/benchmarks/security-controls-v2-governance-strategy#gs-6-define-identity-and-privileged-access-strategy

data.name: GuestUserAccessRestriction2_Rationale
data.value: Guest users do not have the most restricted access

data.name: GuestUserAccessRestriction2_Solution
data.value: Open the Azure Console Go to Azure Active Directory Go to External Identities Go to External collaboration settings Under "Guest user access", change the value to "Guest user access is restricted to properties and memberships of their own directory objects" (most restrictive)

data.name: GuestUserAccessRestriction2_TechnicalExplanation
data.value: By default guests users are restricted from exploring the directory. But giving an existing account it is possible to explore the most of the directory. The technique, available in the export section of PingCastle, consists of enumerating groups from a given users, then to enumerate the members of these groups and to continue recursively. To prohibit this technique, restrict this exploration to the groups where the guest belongs.

data.name: GuestUserAccessRestriction2_Title
data.value: Check if guests have the most restricted access level
